While he was saying these things to them, a chief man came and prostrated himself before him, saying: My daughter has just died; but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live. And Jesus got up and followed him with his disciples. And behold, a woman sick with an issue of blood for twelve years, she came up behind her and touched the edge of her cloak; because she said within herself: If I only touch her cloak, I will be saved. But Jesus, turning and looking at her, said: Have courage, daughter; your faith has saved you. And the woman was saved from that hour. When Jesus entered the house of the principal, seeing those who played flutes, and the people who were making a disturbance, he told them: Separate yourselves, because the girl is not dead, but is sleeping. And they made fun of him. But when the people had been thrown out, he went in, and took the girl by the hand, and she got up.

Jesus left there and went to the region of Tire and Sidon. And behold, a Canaanite woman who had come out of that region cried out to him, saying: Lord, Son of David, have mercy on me! My daughter is severely tormented by a demon. But Jesus did not answer a word. Then her disciples approached and besought her, saying, Send her away, for she cries after us. He answering, said: I am not sent but to the lost sheep of the house of Israel. Then she came and prostrated herself before him, saying: Lord, help me! Answering him, she said: It is not good to take the children\'s bread, and throw it to the little dogs. And she said: Yes, Lord; but even the little dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters\' table. Then answering Jesus, she said: O woman, great is your faith; do with you as you want. And his daughter was healed from that hour.

As Jesus went to Jerusalem, he passed between Samaria and Galilee. And as he entered a village, ten men with leprosy met him, who stood at a distance and raised their voices, saying: Jesus, Master, have mercy on us! When he saw them, he said to them: Go, show yourselves to the priests. And it happened that as they were going they were cleaned. Then one of them, seeing that he had been healed, returned, glorifying God with a loud voice, and fell on his face to the ground at his feet, giving him thanks; and this was a Samaritan. Answering Jesus, he said: Are not ten that were cleansed? And the nine, where are they? Was there no one who returned and gave glory to God but this foreigner? And he said to him: Get up, go; your faith has saved you.

Entering Jesus into Capernaum, a centurion came to him, beseeching him, and saying: Lord, my servant is prostrate at home, paralyzed, grievously tormented. And Jesus said to him: I will go and heal him. The centurion answered and said: Lord, I am not worthy to have you come under my roof; just say the word, and my servant will be healed. For I too am a man under authority, and I have soldiers under me; and I say to him: Go, and he goes; and to the other: Come, and it comes; and to my servant: Do this, and he does it. When Jesus heard it, he was amazed, and said to those who followed him: Truly I tell you, not even in Israel have I found such faith. And I tell you that many will come from the east and from the west, and will sit down with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven; but the sons of the kingdom will be cast into outer darkness; there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth. Then Jesus said to the centurion: Go, and as you believed, may it be done to you. And his servant was healed that very hour.

Jesus taught in a synagogue on the Sabbath; and there was a woman there who had had a spirit of infirmity for eighteen years, and she walked bent over, and could not straighten up at all. When Jesus saw her, he called her and said: Woman, you are free from your disease. And he laid his hands on her; and she straightened up afterwards, and she glorified God

It happened on a Sabbath day, that having entered to eat in the house of a ruler, who was a Pharisee, they were lying in wait for him. And behold, a man with dropsy stood before him. Then Jesus spoke to the lawyers and to the Pharisees, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath? But they kept silent. And he, taking him, healed him, and sent him away.

They came to the other side of the sea, to the region of the Gadarenes. And when he got out of the boat, immediately there came to meet him from the tombs a man with an unclean spirit, who had his abode in the tombs, and no one could bind him, not even with chains. For many times he had been bound with shackles and chains, but the chains had been torn to pieces by him, and the shackles crushed; and no one could control him. And always, day and night, he was crying out in the mountains and in the tombs, and wounding himself with stones. So when he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and knelt before him. And crying out with a loud voice, he said: What do you have with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I conjure you by God that you do not torment me. Because he said to him: Get out of this man, you unclean spirit. And he asked her: What\'s your name? And he answered saying: My name is Legion; because we are many. And he begged her very much not to send them out of that region. There was a large herd of pigs near the mountain. And all the demons begged him, saying: Send us the pigs so that we can enter them. And then Jesus gave them permission. And those unclean spirits came out and entered the pigs, which were about two thousand; and the herd rushed down a steep bank into the sea, and were drowned in the sea.

Then Jesus came again to Cana in Galilee, where he had turned water into wine. And there was a certain king\'s officer there whose son was sick in Capernaum. When he heard that Jesus had come from Judea to Galilee, he went to meet him and begged him to come down and heal his son, because he was near death. Jesus then told him, "If you don\'t see signs and wonders, you won\'t believe." The king\'s officer said to him, "Lord, come down before my son dies." "You can go, your son lives," Jesus told him. And the man believed the word that Jesus said to him, and he left. And while he was going down to his house, his servants met him and told him that his son was alive.

And when he saw a fig tree by the road, he went to it, but found nothing on it but only leaves, and he said to it: "Never again will fruit sprout from you." And immediately he withered the fig tree. The disciples were amazed when they saw this, and they said: "How is it that the fig tree withered instantly?" Jesus answered them, “Truly I tell you, if you have faith and do not doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you say to this mountain, \'Get down and throw yourself into the sea,\' it will happen. And whatever you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive."
And one of them struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear. But Jesus said, “Stop! Enough of this." And touching the ear of the servant, he healed him
